casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Charles Ward AYERS No. 295P18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 27, 2019 Sean Paul Vitrano, Attorney at Law, for Ayers, Charles Ward. Alesia Mikhaulauna Balshakova, Mary Carla Babb, Assistant Attorney Generals, Daniel P. O'Brien, Special Deputy Attorney General, N. Lorrin Freeman, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina.

ORDER

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 12th of September 2018 by State of NC for Temporary Stay:

"Motion Dissolved by order of the Court in conference, this the 27th of March 2019."

Upon consideration of the petition filed by State of NC on the 12th of September 2018 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 27th of March 2019."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 9th of October 2018 by State of NC in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 27th of March 2019."
